#summary Declaration of constructors.

= Constructor declaration =
The syntax to declare a constructor is specified by:
<em><pre>
constructor-declaration:
    annotations,,opt,, constructor-modifiers,,opt,, identifier type-parameter-list,,opt,, *(* formal-parameter-list,,opt,, *)* 
            constructor-initializer,,opt,, type-parameter-constraints-clauses,,opt,, constructor-body

constructor-body:
    block
    *;*
</pre></em>

= Constructor modifiers =
The constructor modifiers in Stab have the same usage and semantics that the constructor modifiers in Java.
<em><pre>
constructor-modifiers:
    constructor-modifier
    constructor-modifiers constructor-modifier
    
constructor-modifier:
    *One of public protected private synchronized native strictfp*
</pre></em>
= Constructor declarator =
The constructor declarator is used to call a base constructor or a constructor of this class.
<pre>_
constructor-declarator:
    *: super (* argument-list,,opt,, *)* 
    *: this (* argument-list,,opt,, *)* 
_</pre>
For example:
{{{
class A {
    A(int i) {}
}
class B : A {
    B(int i) : super(i) {}
    B() : this(0) {}
}
}}}
